{"step_by_step_thinking": "Acute liver failure is a rapid loss of liver function. Different drugs can cause this condition, but the most common one is Paracetamol. Paracetamol, also known as acetaminophen, is a widely used over-the-counter analgesic and antipyretic. It is safe in therapeutic doses, but overdose can result in liver damage, and it is the most common cause of acute liver failure in the Western world. Valproate, Warfarin, and Tetracyclines can also cause liver damage, but they are not as commonly implicated as Paracetamol.", "answer_choice": "A"}
